conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on each ball using the conditions given.
Ball A is hanging vertically, Ball B is in contact with the bowl, Ball C is hanging vertically.
Ball A has a force of weight \( m_A g \) downward.
Ball B has no normal force from the bowl, forces are tensions \( T_1 \) and \( T_2 \).
Ball C has a force of weight \( m_C g \) downward.
Net force on Ball B must be zero, resolve forces into x and y components.
Vertical components: \( T_1 \cos \theta + T_2 \cos \theta = m_B g \).
Horizontal components: \( T_1 \sin \theta = T_2 \sin \theta \), so \( T_1 = T_2 \).
Substitute \( T_1 = T_2 \) into y-direction equation: \( 2T_1 \cos \theta = m_B g \).
For Ball A, \( T_1 = m_A g \), so \( m_A = \frac{m_B}{2 \cos \theta} \).
For Ball C, \( T_2 = m_C g \), so \( m_C = \frac{m_B}{2 \cos \theta} \).
Since \( m_A = m_C \), the mass ratio \( \frac{m_A}{m_C} = 1 \).
The mass ratio of the A ball to the C ball is 1.
